title.rendered: The US. Senators ask Meta about Crypto Scam Prevention.

content.rendered:
With Meta expanding into the metaverse, numerous US senators request Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg to demonstrate Meta’s commitment to crypto fraud prevention on its platforms. New Jersey Democrat Bob Menedez, who heads the group, sent the letter to Facebook and WhatsApp CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Friday, demanding details on how the company is combating cryptocurrency-related scams.

Menedez and his colleagues allege in the letter that Meta acts as a breeding ground for crypto fraud that significantly harms consumers. Senators Sherrod Brown, Elizabeth Warren, Dianne Feinstein, Bernie Sanders, and Cory Booker signed the letter. Although crypto scams are prevalent across all social media platforms, the Senators called out five Meta sites as prime targets for bad actors. 32% of crypto scam cases happened on Instagram, 26% on Facebook, and 9% on WhatsApp.

The Senators also expressed concern that the Facebook parent company is not doing enough to prevent the spread of false Spanish material. They asked if Meta had any resources for preventing or recovering from crypto scams in other languages.

The senators asked Meta to explain its current procedures, including its methods for vetting crypto adverts and banishing fraudsters before they go live. Besides that, the company is also under doubt for its proactive education and protection of its users, cooperation with law authorities, and the removal of fraudsters.
